caption: Awesome staff and environment 🤟 where’s the Michelin star?!?!?!
Great food and awesome service!!

Just had a staycation at the One Hotel and grabbed an early evening snack at the Osprey. There’s a first time for a everything, and this was the first time I had a waiter actually treat me and my girlfriend like we were below him and not worth his attention or time.  As soon as I walked in me and girlfriend felt like a nuisance rather than a guest on a slow Saturday evening.  Was served by African American waiter with glasses, seemed normal but was met by passive aggression and negligence for seemingly no reason.  1. Several times rudely told to put dishes back on the used tray for him as he walked away. 2. When given flat wine that tasted like vinegar, was dismissed at first then told to “put the old glass on the tray man.” lol A waiter telling us to bus his dishes for him. 3. Sarcastic comments and negligent service (talking and gossiping while having long waifs between being checked on or given water or ice)  We live up the street so this was a staycation in our own borough, now I know why only tourists who don’t know any better go here.  Avoid this restaurant and avoid this hotel. Hope they get their act together.

Staff was careless and completely forgot our second course.  We were seated outside on a very cold day and when we asked to move or get a space heater for our table we were advised it wasn’t possible due to bookings (?) so we proceed to spend around 2.5 hrs freezing and eating cold food on their patio while other tables with space heaters sat empty for the duration of our visit.  Cocktails were ok but not impressive or memorable by any means. I ordered a “spicy” Bloody Mary and it was the flattest, most flavourless Bloody Mary I’ve ever consumed. It was oddly sweet and the olives garnishing my drink were so old they sort of melted/disintegrated when I took a bite. So gross and off putting.  Churros for dessert were delicious and the only thing worth ordering which really says a lot.  For the careless and unhelpful service, and some clear sloppiness and the blandness of the meal, I wouldn’t advise coming to this restaurant as there are better options.
Delicious food and very friendly staff! Perfect for Sunday day-drinking
Excellent, friendly service with heated outdoor tables. ^*Especially good plant based choices.

Solid 3 stars. Made 2 different reservations for 8:30 for the ROOFTOP area and when we arrived at 8:15 they tell us the rooftop is closed for a private event. Why was this not reflected on the website? The hostess tells us we could sit outside on the ground floor behind the trees. We asked if there was at least a view and of course there was not. It was freezing out and we were wondering why a few tables were heated and others not.  The waiter was extremely kind. He gets 5 stars. I thought the food and drinks were extremely overpriced for what they were. Wouldn’t recommend as there are plenty of other places nearby that will give you more food for what you pay.
Is that it? Is that it? Is that it? It's a terrible experience.

We pass this restaurant often on our daily walks through the park.   Its lush patio always intrigued me and it's here that I dragged my bf here for his birthday, recently.   He requested close and casual so it fit his bill. It was our first dinner out in nyc since lockdown (and likely our only meal out about town this year).  I do like that the hotel and restaurant take covid precautions seriously.  The host greeted us at the front, took our temperatures and then let us check in at the reception area.  They explained that there was a 3 step disinfecting process for tables.  Once we were led to our table,  (about 15 mins after our reservation) we were told to view menus by scanning QR codes- so no paper menus to touch.   The tables were nicely spaced out.   And of course, the setting is very pretty, a nice patio, with string lights and far away from car exhaust, pedestrians, runners and bicycles.   if you're neurotic/paranoid/anxious- this  restaurant is an excellent choice.  As for the rest of our experience - i would say it was good to adequate. Our server was pleasant but he struggled to keep up with the tables. I'll spare the details.  I know everyone is trying their hardest and these are trying times.  Our pineapple jalapeno cocktails were excellent (best part of the meal) and the food  (tuna tartare, burger, jerk chicken) was average to just above average.  Portions were generous, prices on the higher end. Gratuity of 18pct (more than fair) will be included in your bill.  Rating: 3.5 rounded up to 4.
Came for a brunch with friend, great service and food!" Beautiful decor, and atmosphere is above my expectation.

Beautiful, idyllic setting in the middle of Brooklyn Bridge Park. Lovely hotel and patio with nice spacing between tables and a good system for contactless service.  Best french fries I ever ate, main course was just okay. Service was a little slow, though the manager was great.  It was a little hard to get to from the train, but I would definitely come back for the setting alone. Good coffee too!
Atmosphere, service, food, drinks were above my expectations. Hidden location in Dumbo. Loved it. Will certainly go back again.

The only thing good about The Osprey is the food. I went there for the second time last Saturday, in hopes that they would redeem themselves from the first experience, but even on a different day with different staff, the experience (other than the food) was absolutely terrible.  Our party waited over 90 mins to be seated, though we tried calling ahead hours before for a reservation. When they finally called our party to be seated, they said we there were less people than what we mentioned over an hour and a half before. The host and who I believe was the manager we're unpleasant and came off disingenuous when we expressed our concerns. They proceeded to tell us that their mistake changes everything. As if to say, we might have to wait another undisclosed amount of time. Eventually they said we can be seated, and sat us at the smallest table you can find...for a party greater than 2! To add insult to injury, there were a significant amount of (larger) tables available that were completely empty, approximately 7...I counted...and just a handful of guests (12) that were dining on their outside patio. When asked why we couldn't sit at their those table, we were told that they were "reserved". . .of course they were!!  Minus the extreme wait, I was there with a different party 2 weeks prior and we had a similar incident. In that experience, they told us the only large table available was in the sun with no shade or it's a 45 min to 1 hour wait. We had other plans and decided to opt for the sunny seats. Once we got to the back patio, there once more was just a handful of guests and a significant amount of empty large table in the shade! When asked why we could not sit there, we were told...you guessed it, they were "reserved". After 30 minutes in the sweltering sun, we asked if we can relocate to one of the many empty tables in the shade. We were told, they have to wait 10-15 more minutes to see if anyone cancels their reservation. I asked well what time was their reservation, and the time they made-up (I mean told us) was over an hour before. Finally 20 minutes later they squeazed us in the corner at an even smaller table! Yet still after all that time the food took forever to come ( hour for bean burgers with fries), one person in our party order was missing an item.  All I can say is, I will never dine there again and will never recommend anyone to...unless you want to go through a ridiculous and nonsensical experience for a tasty bean burger...the only reason I gave them 1 star was because I couldn't give them "no stars".

We have been here for breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner and are always amazed by the amazing flavors! The place is amazing but our server seemed to be a little bit frustrated with the tables and didn't give us the service we expected. The tuna tartare with a green matcha sponge or the maitake mushroom as starters are definitely a must

I had a Reservation for 12 o'clock didn't get into my table till 12:45. I thought the wait would be worthy but  I was wrong! The is better places around Brooklyn unless you want to pay for the location.

Delicious food, great customer service, Fabiola was awesome! She was very attentive and professional  ! Had good recommendations on drinks and food! I will definitely come back.  Good atmosphere! The food was delicious !! My congrats to the chefs
Excellent food and drinks. Very friendly and competent service. And an a wonderful atmosphere. Will definitely be back.
Such a nice venue and considerate staff

Overpriced menu for small portions, poor service by unattentive waiter.  Spent $160 with 1 beer and glass wine, tip  and left hungry.  Food was prepared well.  Bought pasta with cheese sauce for $24, listed as "Large Plate", was small as an appetizer portion.  Kale salad and Gazpacho were quite good. Waiter never asked if we wanted another drink, never brought more water though it was a hot evening outside on the deck.  Were there more than 3 hours.

This is one of our favorite spots in Brooklyn. Honestly, I can’t wait for reopening! There is something special about the menu: I remember gazpacho soup was so delicious and fish patè too. This is a spot where you want to come back. The stuff is super professional.
Beautiful atmosphere and great breakfast.
Very nice restaurant and great food.

Came for breakfast. We loved the decor Inside the place Views were very nice. Food was delicious! Looking around, everyone’s breakfast looked so good. Service was “ok” , could of been better. If the service was better, I would of gave 5 stars no question. Overall we had a nice time. We will be back!
(Translated by Google) Well  (Original) Gut

(Translated by Google) The food was modest but the hotel was very beautiful. Be sure to visit the bathroom. There is also a nice view on the way to the restaurant. The statue of liberty and Manhattan can be seen at a glance, and if you walk a little, you can take a picture from Dumbo.  (Original) 음식은 그럭저럭 했으나 같이 위치한 호텔이 너무 아름다웠다. 화장실을 꼭 방문할 것. 또한 레스토랑 가는 길에 멋진 풍경을 구경할 수 있다. 자유의 여신상과 맨하탄이 한눈에 보이며 조금 걸으면 덤보에서 사진도 찍을 수 있어서 관광하기에 굿.
Excellent cuisine in a stunning dining room with an informed, friendly server.

(Translated by Google) I don't know anything else. Brunch. Don't eat here. The picture was terribly good. It's really healthy. It tastes like 1 degree. Rather, the river cafe next to it has better views and price, so go there.  (Original) 딴건 모르겠고 브런치 여기서 먹지 마세요 사진은 겁나 잘나왔는데 진짜 건강한 맛 그 자체라 맛이 1도 업뚬... 차라리 옆에 리버까페가 뷰도 더 좋고 가격대 비슷하면서 훨훨배 맛있으니까 거기 가세요.
Good choices

We booked this place for a NYE dinner for 3 people at 9:15. And this was by far one of the worst “fine-dining” experiences of our lives. 1) That night had a special and very limited prix fix tasting menu of 8 tiny dishes at $180 per person. This situation wasn’t mentioned anywhere when placing the reservation. We only found out upon being seated. 2) When we explained to the manager that the prix fix and it’s pricing was never discussed and had we known we would have booked some place else and now at 9:30 pm on NYE we are unable to do that, she simply said there is nothing they could do and we had to oblige with the menu since they “tried to call as many people as they could to let them know the dinner would be prix fix”. (She was also pretty condescending during that conversation.) 3) We asked to speak to the general manager to see if we could order individual items from the menu without having to do the full tasting course. He then also said he couldn’t do anything about and would have to escalate it to the chef and speak with him .... we insisted he do so. Finally after about 45 minutes of this travesty the chef agreed to serve the courses individually at a per item price (that the waitress was supposed to inform us on) and the courses would be tasting menu appetizer size). 4) we ended up ordering 2 courses each and a drink or two. At the end of the dinner our bill came out to be $114 per person, which is a gross overcharge. Provided that the tasting menu of 8 courses and I believe 3 drinks came in to be $180 per person. So we paid 2/3 or the price for 2 of the items out of the menu. 5) the waitress never broke down individual prices to us as offered by the GM - just asked what we are ordering. The food took about 25-30 for each course. And everyone was extremely condescending and clearly annoyed with us throughout the whole meal. 5) And last but not least, I woke up at 4am with a severe food poisoning and couldn’t manage it for the next 3 hours. I would think it’s a coincidence, but in this case - seems a bit too uncanny. 6) the 2 stars belong to the very sweet and welcoming bartender who made nice drinks and talked to us for the 30 min we waited for our table to be ready in the first place.
Great service!

This was our first time at The Osprey and we had a great Thanksgiving celebration. Service is very nice and took care of everything for us. The food was good and the place is very nicely decorated. We are looking forward to going back in order to check the regular menu! Great job ;)
Food was really good although I couldn't eat a lot of things due to my diet. All the people I know who frequent here love it.
Great atmosphere and food. The service needs some work...
Elvis & Danny Showed So Much Love & Amazing Service Yesterday For Brunch. I Will Definitely Recommend & Return To The Osprey! Thank You

Great place to eat, downstairs or upstairs upstairs is 10R and only serves lunch/dinner and drinks. Recommend them getting coffee as nice in mornings. A little hard to get to from subway, around 10 minutes, but worth it. View from seat.

So good! Each course was better than the next. Every picky pot New Yorker (including me! ha ha) was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed the meal! I decided to hold a big bday party here. The events people were lovely. Everyone accommodated us. And the food was tasty -yum yum!

Elvis was amazing! He set me up with a table with an amazing view and provided the best customer service. I often travel to NYC and will definitely stay at this hotel and will come back to the restaurant because of him! Will recommend anyone interested in staying here or even coming into the restaurant for a great brunch experience.
Great food and perfect service! Will be back.
Adequate. Probably won't be back.

We had a birthday dinner for 8 here last night and it was wonderful. Our server was highly attentive, funny and very helpful. The ambience was great. It wasn’t too bus inside, nicely buzzing. There was a lot going on outside on the patio. The food was very good. The Brussel sprout side and the white gazpacho appetizer were particular highlights. Yes, it’s a little pricey but nothing insane for NYC.

Loved. Giant pot of tea. Steak and eggs were dee-lish, cooked perfectly. And I also got the seafood Cobb salad which was amaze! After brunch went up to the rooftop bar. Stunning views of Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan.

Ambiance and view are great. But unless you’re a hotel guest the service is slow and rude. Also, for 20$/ person cover charge less than half the deck is available to you and half of that is reserved for food. Not worth the cost. Won’t go back to just the bar again. But I might consider staying at the hotel as a guest.

The location of this contemporary restaurant is stunning, the atmosphere perfect and the food was tasty. Unfortunately the service was terrible.  Even though the staff was friendly and helpful, it cannot make up for the loooong waiting times. We had to wait for more than 15 minutes before being acknowledged. Once seated, it took again over 15 minutes before receiving a menu and another 30 before taking our order. The beverages and food arrived rather quickly and the food was tasty as mentioned earlier. Our mood soured when we had to wait yet again for more than 15 minutes after asking for the check.  Not sure what went wrong that night, they did not seem short staffed. Let’s hope they don’t make a habit out of it.

This is my second time here for Sunday brunch.  The first time was okay, the food is generally good if not a little unimaginative.  I had a problem today because 15 minutes after our orders were placed, two of us were informed that our selection was no longer available. 15 minutes!! You shouldn’t need 15 minutes to know when you’ve run out of something. Because of the long lag informing us, we ended up not ordering our second choice but picking something that could be made quickly and wouldn’t destroy the meal for the entire table due to lag. As it was, our food came out five minutes after the rest of the table. This place aims high and was seriously lacking today. Brunch is supposed to be a happy, relaxing endeavor. Today the opposite was experienced.  I was hard pressed to identify a manager to whom I could complain. The waiter didn’t offer or bring one around even though I made it clear how displeased I was. Perhaps this is a teaching moment, coach the staff to at least pretend to care about the customers.

This was a birthday dinner for my daughter, beautiful restaurant, comfortable, warm and accommodating staff.  The food had very clean flavors, cocktails were good and they could not have been nicer.  The chef is a very young talented and creative up and coming force to be reckon with, I would try his creations before he becomes too famous!  Outstanding

The food was great and the atmosphere was lovely. Our waitress was super nice and very patient when we took a while to order. However, portion sizes were small considering how expensive it was. Still, the service was quick and overall, the experience was worth it.

Booked an event for 17 people with Melissa an event organizer. Upon arriving we see we had 2 tables one and in the back another. Why would you sit us separately for a family event and not even confirming if that is ok with me or not?? We asked to have one table where we were offered to sit outside but there will be an additional charge of $10 per person!! No problem.  We agreed. Reservation was at 5:30pm. Starting around 8pm I had to ask multiple times where is the food and why it's not coming ..especially, when its pre fix menu! At 9:15 i had to ask to cut a cake that we brought were and they charge an additional $5 per person for that. By the time they brought our cake, 70% of my guest had to leave. But wait..pre fix menu came with desert and hot beverages which,  NEVER CAME!!! It is absolutely horrible service and not the best food for the money they charge. Look somewhere else
Fancy place in a nice location near PIER1. My experience was great: a well served omelete and a tasteful salad. Not unexpensive but fair price vs quality ratio.
(Translated by Google) Comfortable, not a lot of people. Athosfera seaside restaurant.  (Original) Уютно, людей не много. Атосфера приморского ресторанчика.
Fantastic, you should check it out!

(Translated by Google) Very good restaurant, perfect service, attentive personel. REFINED meals, quality, correct prices. As a bonus, the view of One WTC. Definitely the best way to end our New York stay. We recommend ! Thank you !  Very good restaurant, perfect service, very careful people, and wonderful quality plates, correct prices. On top of that, the view on the One WTC. Definitely the best way to travel to New York trip. We recommend. Thanks!  (Original) Très bon restaurant, service parfait, personel attentionné. Mets RAFFINÉS, de qualité, tarifs corrects. En prime, la vue sur One WTC. Définitivement la meilleure manière de clore notre séjour new yorkais. Nous recommandons ! Merci !  Very good restaurant, perfect service, people very careful, et wonderful quality plates, correct prices. On top of that, the view on the One WTC. Definitely the best way for us to end our New York trip. We recommend. Thanks!

Fancy place with a very friendly staff. Definitely on the pricy side with a menu that felt somewhat limited. Ordered the skirt steak which was delicious but, for the price, wished that it came with a bit more than just a side of greens. The pork chop on the other hand was huge and came with greens and a side of caramelized apples. Afterwards you can walk nearby to a scenic view of the Brooklyn Bridge or even take a walk across.
Amazing food and beautiful atmosphere. Fresh juices. Great place for Sunday brunch.
Really nice place for chill and hangout. Food is price but delicious. Staff is very friendly. The view is not that great as on rooftop.
really great salad

I had a reservation for my now fiance and I saturday night and overall experience was fantastic. Atmosphere of the place is lively and view is amazing! This was the night I proposed to my girlfriend, although i didn't do it in the restaurant, we went up to harriets rooftop, which is connected due to the 1 hotel, and proposed there. The house was great, the waitress at the osprey was amazing and the waiter at the rooftop was amazing! If you would like to see a great view and have a few drinks with friends, this is the place. Great place for the woman of your dreams to say yes when you ask for her hand in marriage!

Went here to grab a drink with friends on a Sunday afternoon! The big table in the middle provides great view of Brooklyn Waterfront! The drinks were pricy as expected given the premium location. The place is filled with tourists which is also expected given its inside a hotel!

The food was good for a spot of lunch, unfortunately the service was very poor, one dish came out 10 minutes after the others, very slow and disorganised service that became very frustrating from a customer perspective.

The Osprey is worth the trek to Brooklyn Bridge Park. It's a gorgeous waterfront restaurant connected to the 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge at Pier 1. Delicious food, boozy cocktails, and chic decor, this is the place I'd recommend to tourists. More affordable and inviting than The River cafe too. Our server, John gave us outstanding service and the entire staff was friendly. I highly recommend it.
The Ancient Grains, Chickpea Stew and Branzino were excellent. The ambiance and service were also 1st class. Highly recommend

Food and atmosphere was good but service lacked given how expensive the menu is.  Took a while to get our drinks at brunch and then the food didn't all come out at once.  In general was great but would just expect a more seamless service experience given what you're paying.

username: The Throttles and Life of Jessi

caption: Wasn’t too crowded in a Friday and bartender was super attentive
Nothing too special.  A decent, pricey Brooklyn brunch.  Very much a scene.

Great location be with beautiful views of Manhattan. The food is amazing, the cocktails are spectacular, and the service is impeccable. Luis was amazing he was so attentive and we didn't have to ask for anything. He anticipated our every need and had it covered. I can't wait until my next visit to the Osprey.

Came here for restaurant week. We sat by the window and got to see the BK bridge at night, it was beautiful. The service was fast and great, would definitely come back again. I asked the waitress to recommend a drink similar to the osprey and she gave me one that I really liked ... something with the word "doctor."

Unfortunately, pleasant decor and atmosphere can’t make up for the poor quality of the food.   Ordered a frittata which arrived swimming in some sort of poor tasting oil.  My guest’s omelet which was supposed to be tomatoes and feta, was not only not an omelet (it was also a frittata swimming in the same oil as mine), but also had excessive amounts of onions and scallions which were not listed on the item description on the menu.   Furthermore, I asked for some toast to go with my unsavory frittata.  Three pieces of white bread arrived in an unnecessarily fancy plate (along with some jam and some other spread which I didn’t recognize, and neither of which I ordered).   I would later find out that I was charged eight (8!) dollars for this bread showmanship.  I wasn’t told that it would cost 8 dollars to get three slices of white bread.   I certainly would not have ordered.  All in all, poor quality on everything and in general a rip off.
Wonderful restaurant . I loved the wine they made
(Translated by Google) I'm not a fan of it, but I can not say enough about it.  (Original) 관자 존맛이지만 너무나도 창렬하기 이루 말할 데가 없어서ㅠ여기다 씀
Great ambience, delicious food and good collection of drinks + the views.

Awful food, great roof. Encouraged to have 4 x personal $10 giant fries with our average joe burgers. Better off getting McDonald’s and walking over the bridge. Unapologetic shoddy service with items forgotten.
Overpriced and bad quality food
Best eggs benny & cortado 🤡
Not worth the money.
Great brunch spot if you're in the area. Friendly staff, great food.
Dirty, sticky tables. Old plates and glasses, horrible tasteless food. Service is disappointing! On the top, very pricey for what offers! Avoid this place!
A great café and restaurant with a wide range of items on the menu. The atmosphere is great, with some quirky decorations.
(Translated by Google) Good atmosphere and recommended burger  (Original) 분위기 좋고 버거 추천
Great upscale food but the dining experience wasn't to expectations

This place is an absolute GEM! The service is GREAT!!! WE came here two weeks ago to celebrate our daughter's BD. Staff were very attentive and helpful with our order. They work as a team to ensure your every need is met. This may be the best staff I have ever encountered. The food is deliceuos and fantastic. I will come to this place, over and over again.
Mediocre. Whole facts.

Very nice restaurant, right off the East River Ferry. Great place for brunch / lunch. There's both indoor and outdoor seating options, so one can take one's pick based on mood and weather conditions. Its convenient location allowed us to hop on a ferry and scoot over from Wall Street, for a very enjoyable Saturday afternoon. My recommendation? Try the waffles and chicken.

The Osprey is a relatively upscale place, with relatively reasonable prices. The food is okay (we went there for brunch, and the menu was quite the standard NY brunch affair) and so is the service. What makes it outstanding though is it’s location - it’s right on the water, ~1 minutes of a walk from the Dumbo pier. Not only is it scenic, but also super convenient to reach. In addition, the neighborhood offers tons of entertainment/dining options, if you’re looking to spend the day out there.
Good service all around. Spinach artichoke dip was fantastic. Cod dish was very good. NY steak was ok. Would go back.
(Translated by Google) Normal  (Original) Normal

Ridiculous. Have been here before, liked it and live locally but this experience really got under my skin. My wife and I strolled in on a summer Saturday late morning for brunch, no reservation just strolling by in a good mood. 30% full at most, 11:30am. Three people standing at the front desk. Do you have a reservation? No. Fake glance at the screen. That'll be a 10 min wait. Are you joking? Oh we have many reservations. Goodbye. Pointless and silly self importance.
Nice staff and very delicious food; loved the vegan burger!
Place is very nice, Food was just ok. Would love to see more unique and interesting menu like the hotel spirit...
Yummy
Burger McDonald's style with vinegary side salad. :(
Delicious

Between the amazing decor, service and food, this place is easily one of the top 2 restaurants in Dumbo! I literally love everything about this place. The duck croquettes are a slam dunk! I'm not a fan of croquettes but I really enjoyed the texture and taste of these. So we were a party of 5, so every one got a different entree. The BEST ENTREE hands down is the scallops with grits. Now...I HATE GRITS...but this dish has turned me into a believer. I probably will not eat anybody grits but this restaurant. This seriously will be my go to restaurant especially for the summer time. All the waitstaff were super friendly and efficient. I didn't feel too rushed and I also didn't feel like I was waiting around even when it got really busy. I had the sangria which was delicious and quite strong which..YES.thank you for that Oh...dessert. The strawberry shortcake was sooo memorable. Again, NOT a fan of shortcake but I would definitely get this EVERY time. Imagine cake with nice cold whip cream filled with fresh sweet ripe strawberries. Long story short, this place is a GEM.

Nice ambience but that's about it?? The food was good but nothing amazing. A bit over price but since it's a hotel restaurant maybe that's acceptable. It was the service that came short really. The menu that's on their website is outdated first of all.  We arrived about 30 min early. The hostess politely refused to sit us, saying she'd do that when it's close to my reservation time. There were lots of empty seats so i was like ???? But sure. When we returned close to our reservation time, there was a gentleman before us wishing to be seated earlier than the reservation time. She again politely refused. The man pointed out empty seats but she said they are reserved and the time is coming soon. Ok. Understandable. We were seated but the service was very slow. And if I'm not mistaken the mug in front of me had lipstick/lipmark on it. The waiter kept making small mistakes.
Here currently and I’m experiencing terrible service... drinks and food are taking forever I don’t think I will ever be coming back here!! VERY VERY DOSAPOINTED!!!

(Translated by Google) A hotel with attention to detail with a view of the Brooklyn Bridge. Excellent dishes in the restaurant and fantastic views in the top floor lounge bar.  (Original) Un hotel curato nei minimi dettagli com vista sul ponte di Brooklyn. Piatti ottimi al ristorante e una vista fantastica al lounge bar dell'ultimo piano.

Just walking out now. Flabbergasted that after advising my waiter the hitherto unmentioned poppy seeds in both the pancakes and french toast (unconventional, unnecessary ingredient) gave me a very unpleasant allergy attack, the barely disturbed plates were left on the table and nothing was subtracted from the bill. Come on guys. Basic protocol, basic courtesy. Brunch ruined.
The bartenders are slow and rude. Horrible service.

The wait was long. That's fine. But they must have told us "10 minutes" half a dozen times over the course of about an hour and a half. Our meals took so long that we considered leaving before it came out. And it was very mediocre food. Sides were cold; main dishes were generally flavorless. That said, our server was delightful.

Before making my very first visit, I was a little hesitant due to some atrocious reviews left on foursquare and yelp. But I live close to the restaurant and the weather was really nice so gave it a try anyways for a walk to the area. After our first bites, my husband and I were simply blown away! Their egg sandwich was just divine, cornmeal pancake was perfect, and the fries were thin and crispy. The service could be faster, but the restaurant was extremely busy and packed so the slow pace of the service was understandable. Overall, it was a pleasantly slow yet delicious weekend brunch.
(Translated by Google) amazing meat! The best rib steak in my life!  (Original) viande incroyable !  La meilleure entrecôte de ma vie !
Atmosphere and decor were impeccable. Got a glass of white wine and was able to sit outside and just hangout even when there was no outside service. Felt like Europe... Thx Osprey

I flew in from Canada to watch a boxing fight and I decided to visit this lounge before heading there. I Would like to say thank you to the bartender and waitress who were far to kind! The service was amazing and the cocktails were world class. I will definitely be coming back here when I visit NYC again. Cheers

The decor is nice and the restaurant has nice views of lower Manhattan. I'm sure in the summer it will be nice as well when you can sit on the outdoor patio. The service is attentive and the portion size is good. Most of the food we tried is good as well. Here's why 3 instead of 5 stars. 1) the steak was tasty, but definitely not one of the better steaks I've had. 2) the parking situation is difficult and valet if I remember correctly is $20.
Probably some of the best food in the world. Seriously, you must try it.

Great atmosphere.  Good service.  Very  modem comfortable feel to the place.  Gorgeous wood panels,  great tops.  Kid friendly amongst the staff and the guests.  Lovely views out the window into the river.  beer is great and cocktails are well done.  Good selection on spirits too.  Of course all the other shops are in the building or nearby.  Definitely a must.  Price is comfortable.
Lovely, fancy, but not too expensive.
Great vegetarian options and beautiful plating.
Great cocktails with dreaming view over Manhattan skyline!
Great place for a brunch.. must try their pancakes and cocktails..
(Translated by Google) A modern and very new place. A menu with some interesting alternatives.  (Original) Un lugar moderno y muy nuevo. Un menú con algunas alternativas interesantes.

Food deserve 5 star, service 3. We went there for our Thanksgiving dinner. 7 people. Almost everybody ordered different food, which was delicious. Bravo kitchen!!! Unfortunately, service was’t top. We ordered 4 different red wines. The server was’t trained enough to poor wine. In five star restaurant you shouldn’t have empty glass of wine on your table, right? Also, we ordered a lot of deserts with coffee. They were delicious, but coffees were served after we ate desserts. Can you synchronize that somehow? I drink a lot of espresso. Your espresso was bad, really bad. I didn’t finished it. So bitter and tasteless. I think you should train your barista and order better coffee....
Perfect early breakfast, service is great, food is delicious.
Really great food and amazing vibe. Make sure you try the beet salad,  sausage, and prime rib.  Drinks are fantastic as well! Highly recommended.

Dined here the other night and the food was ok. The steak was tough and the salad I ordered was NOT fresh! My server tried to handle the situation but the manager lady was so rude! She rolled her eyes after speaking to my table as if WE were in the wrong! I will NOT be coming back to this place!

Hard to describe how good the food is. We read about their slow roaster on Eater, so we tried their 2 dishes that come out of it - the rotisserie chicken and prime rib. My god - we were completely blown away. We both agreed that these were the two top dishes we had all year. The texture of the prime rib is perfect, unbelievably tasty. The chicken is in a wonderfully complemented vegetable stew. Even the squash we had on the side was exceptional - makes us want to try the entire menu. Great atmosphere - all glass windows with views across the east river to lower Manhattan. Service is excellent. We will definitely be back - and often!
